topics.title: Can't post on zeroboard
topics.body:
When pressing "Submit message" get "Message submit failed!
undefined" error.

topics.title: Can't update a file on ZeroTalk.
topics.body: Get error "Site:1TaLk3..sPKQ data/users/1NAKbzLfAGMAPKUYGuQnxrEKJeu4MCVyyQ/data. json file size does not match 74 <> 434, Hash: False" in my python console. Is some one trying to post from fake account on something like this? Or is it a some kind of condition racing?

1@35.body: I think you can't do it now. Theoretically, if your password is strong enough, site designer can store your private key encrypted with your password in the shared DB, then you'll be able to log in from anywhere with you account name and password.

1@31.body: Now it works. Seems that the problem was somehow resolved with the update to 0.2.4, or update on ZeroBoard :-)

13@2.body:
Isn't it planned to allow users store sites only partially? It will be useful for any big site, not only for youtube-like.
For example: if site size is less then 10 Mb, user downloads all content. If it's bigger, user store only pages that he has watched himself plus some part of the site that has fewest nodes sharing it.

16@2.body: Feature of downloading sites only partially is planned, but not implemented yet, as far as I know.
